image.altText: Members of the Ukrainian National Guard look up while dressed in military uniforms.

items.synopsis: Moscow has stepped up strikes on Ukraine in the past few days, as Kyiv prepares for a counteroffensive in which it is expected to try to retake occupied territory in the Kherson region.

title.children: Russian shelling kills 23 in Kherson as Ukraine's Zelenskyy visits International Criminal Court

image.altText: Victorian power - Snowy Hydro

items.synopsis: A bitter rift between the former boss of state-owned power provider Snowy Hydro and federal Energy Minister Chris Bowen has widened following claims Labor's green energy plans are not achievable.

title.children: Fuse blown as former Snowy Hydro boss takes aim at 'bulls**t' renewable energy goals

image.altText: A close-up of a man with grey hair looking to the side, not smiling.

items.synopsis: Senior Victorian Liberals have already begun discussing if MP Moira Deeming should be expelled from the party room over her threats to sue Opposition Leader John Pesutto.

title.children: Exiled MP Moira Deeming tells Opposition Leader John Pesutto she is taking legal action over her suspension

image.altText: A dark brick building facade on a cloudy day. the words "Horsham Law Courts" and "Entry" are on the front

items.synopsis: A South Australian B-double driver has been sentenced to more than three years in prison for dangerous driving causing the death of 24-year-old Liam Batson, in what the judge described as an act of "considerable culpability".

title.children: Truck driver jailed over death of Horsham cyclist, father of two whose family is now 'incomplete'

image.altText: Anika Wells speaks in parliament.

items.synopsis: The nurses union warns the aged care sector has form when it comes to avoiding paying wage rises, and says the government must oblige providers to pass on a historic 15 per cent pay increase to all workers, not just those on award rates.

title.children: Nurses union fears nursing homes won't pass on 'historic' $11.3 billion budget commitment to boost aged care wages

image.altText: A man walking in a suit outside court

items.synopsis: Adam Cranston is one of five people found guilty of two charges over various roles in the Plutus Payroll scam, which ran for about three years to 2017.

title.children: Judge 'flabbergasted' legal aid pulled for one of architects of $105m tax fraud

image.altText: University staff march down a street, waving union flags and holding signs that say "I'm on strike!"

items.synopsis: University tutors who say they cannot plan for their futures are among the thousands of university staff to walk off the job as part of a national week of action against insecure work and wage theft.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' university strike in Melbourne to continue after years of 'anger and discontent'

image.altText: The logos of the four big banks in Australia

items.synopsis: Here is a breakdown of which major banks have responded to the RBA's decision, and which ones we're still waiting on.

title.children: Which banks are changing their interest rates as the RBA makes its 11th increase in 12 months

image.altText: A man in a akubra style hat smiles at the camera while patting his white husky dog

items.synopsis: A neighbour who was with Sean Ferris minutes before he stabbed two police officers and was then shot dead says the incident should never has escalated to this — as homemade weapons and a Samurai sword are removed from the property.

title.children: 'It shouldn't have escalated to this': Man shot in police incident had known mental health issues, neighbour says

image.altText: Two men smile in an image composite.

items.synopsis: One of two police officers attacked and stabbed in SA's Mid North has been discharged from hospital while the other is showing "positive progress" following surgery for critical injuries last night, the state's police commissioner says.

title.children: Stabbed SA policeman discharged from hospital, other showing 'positive progress' following surgery

image.altText: A police cordon and police car out the front of a suburban Darwin home

items.synopsis: Northern Territory Police say they are treating the death of the 23-year-old Bangladeshi man as a homicide. A man remains in custody but has not been charged.

title.children: International student dies at Darwin hospital after violent home invasion

image.altText: A helicopter landed on an oval.

items.synopsis: The Australian Defence Force says it is making inquiries after a helicopter painted in army colours that is no longer part of its fleet made an emergency landing in Melbourne this afternoon.

title.children: Defence force says camo helicopter that made emergency landing on suburban oval not in army fleet

image.altText: Peter Hollingworth

items.synopsis: A second Anglican Church investigation probing former governor-general Peter Hollingworth's handling of child abuse during his tenure as Archbishop of Brisbane in the 1990s, has been held in secret.

title.children: Ex-governor-general Peter Hollingworth faces second inquiry into handling of child abuse

image.altText: hand holding phone displaying navigation map

items.synopsis: Google Maps agrees to divert drivers away from a country Victorian road where five people recently died in a three-vehicle accident, but residents want more action to prevent further tragedies.

title.children: Google Maps diverts drivers away from deadly Victorian road where five people died during April

image.altText: Jana Pittman, in green and gold lycra top and bottom, smiles widely holding the outstretched Australian flag, with crowd behind.

items.synopsis: When the media turned on her after the 2004 Athens Olympics, Jana Pittman was filled with self-doubt, and it wasn't the first time. Here's how she turned things around.

title.children: Jana Pittman is a former world champion, a mum of six and a doctor. But her 'greatest success' is something else

image.altText: Multiple people in high vis gear standing around a door archway

items.synopsis: Police suggested those who died were likely homeless people who were occupying abandoned buildings where a new neighbourhood is expected to be built in the coming years.

title.children: Eight people die in building containers fire in Czechia

image.altText: A man with long hair and a beard next to another man with short, grey hair and a business suit.

items.synopsis: Mike Cannon-Brookes and Andrew "Twiggy" Forrest used to be lead investment partners on the $30 billion Sun Cable project. Now, they're bidding against each other to control it in a closed-door process close to resolution.

title.children: 'Get your act together': A town's message to two of Australia's richest men as they struggle for control over solar farm

image.altText: Green lights are shone onto a person's leg.

items.synopsis: 7.30 goes inside Melbourne's supervised drug injecting room, which experts say is helping keep drugs off the street, while some locals say it's made things worse.

title.children: Inside the controversial centre where clients 'shoot up'

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a blue woolen jumper sits at an outdoor table covered in carrots

items.synopsis: The northern Geelong suburb of Norlane tops an ABS list of areas in Victoria facing the most disadvantage. But amid the grim statistics and intergenerational challenges, a strong community is taking steps forward.

title.children: Rhyse's community is labelled Victoria's most disadvantaged. She knows the challenges first-hand

image.altText: A women stands and looks into the distance.

items.synopsis: The change is the result of a campaign being led by abuse survivor and former Australian of the Year Grace Tame, and is similar to changes made in other states.

title.children: SA introduces changes to wording of child sexual abuse offences, after campaign by Grace Tame

image.altText: A yellow M on a red square sign

items.synopsis: A South Australian McDonald's franchisee has been fined $275,000 for threatening to demote employees and reduce their hours if they joined the union.

title.children: Former McDonald's franchisee fined for 'appalling' breach of workers' rights

image.altText: Image of a person outside court in Perth. Their face is blurred and they are wearing a black suit jacket with a white shirt.

items.synopsis: The 42-year-old woman had already pleaded guilty to six counts of abusing the girl, more than a decade ago.

title.children: Female teacher guilty of further charge of sexually abusing teen student

items.synopsis: The government is not collecting enough money, and you are paying too much, says the former Treasury boss.

title.children: The man who once held Australia's purse strings says the budget is a 'hell of a mess', but taxing you more isn't the answer

image.altText: A blue sign with white writing on a building that reads "Jenny Craig".

items.synopsis: Jenny Craig centres will continue to operate in Australia despite reports the company plans to file for bankruptcy and close in the United States after failing to find a buyer for the weight loss empire.

title.children: Jenny Craig's Australian operations safe as US business reportedly plans to file for bankruptcy

image.altText: An image of the Reserve bank sign in Martin Place, Sydney

items.synopsis: Confused about where we're headed and why we appear to be hurtling headlong towards a self-induced recession? You're in good company, writes Ian Verrender.

title.children: If you're confused about what the RBA's doing, you're not alone. Even the economic experts are stumped

image.altText: Two police cars outside a house on a main road which is draped with police tape

items.synopsis: Students at Charles Darwin University will today hold a vigil for a 23-year-old in a critical condition following a violent home invasion.

title.children: Darwin student remains in ICU after alleged 'random' attack 'in his own bed'

image.altText: A woman gestures as she speaks to media and cameras outside a court building.

items.synopsis: Faith Tkalac says she has "no words" and is overwhelmed with relief after Tasmania's attorney-general intervenes to order an inquest into her son's death, hours after the Supreme Court rejected such a move.

title.children: Attorney-General overrules judge hours after court rejects ordering inquest into man hit by ex-partner's car

image.altText: The Australian taxpayer-backed Future Fund has invested in Adani

items.synopsis: International pressure led to Adani vowing to cut ties with Myanmar's military junta in 2021. Now, leaked documents reveal how the resources giant had been privately negotiating coal ventures with the sanctioned regime leaders.

title.children: 'They've misled the public': Leaked letters reveal mining giant Adani was 'enthused' to work with military dictatorship

image.altText: Carrie Fisher on stage in LA

items.synopsis: The Walk of Fame recognition is a May the Fourth tribute to one of the Star Wars franchise's most beloved figures.

title.children: This May the Fourth, Carrie Fisher gets Walk of Fame star

image.altText: Missy Elliot clapping and smiling with curly purple hair and a cap on

items.synopsis: The Rock & Roll Hall of Fame has announced its 2023 inductees with Missy Elliott becoming the first female hip-hop artist to be inducted.

title.children: Missy Elliott becomes first female hip-hop artist to be inducted into the Rock & Roll Hall of Fame

image.altText: A light ball explodes in the dark sky above the Kremlin in Moscow.

items.synopsis: While Ukraine has on occasion struck targets on Russian territory, a direct assault on the Kremlin, a fortified complex in the heart of Moscow, would be its most audacious attack by far.

title.children: Did Ukraine try to kill Putin or could the drone attack on the Kremlin have been a false flag?

image.altText: A bird's eye view of the front seat of a car.

items.synopsis: Police allege the two boys stole a Mercedes-Benz that was later involved in a crash that killed three people.

title.children: Second 13-year-old charged over alleged car theft linked to triple fatal crash

image.altText: Man in a yellow hoodie standing next to a protester holding a sign shouting.

items.synopsis: At this stage, the UK government won't say how much it's spending on the coronation, but some estimates put it at between $90-180 million — while a recent poll found 51 per cent of Brits believed the coronation shouldn't be taxpayer-funded.

title.children: King Charles III's immense wealth questioned as coronation sparks protests

image.altText: Rhiannon, wearing a black hoodie, stands against a blue wall. She is looking into a window. Her image is reflected back at her.

items.synopsis: With the national rental vacancy rate at a record low for a fourth straight month, welfare workers say they are seeing more and more people being pushed into homelessness.

title.children: A rental market 'firmly locked in favour of landlords' is pushing tenants into homelessness

items.synopsis: Mexico's army welcomes a new search and rescue puppy, gifted from the Turkish government as a gesture of gratitude for the lifesaving work of Mexico's emergency teams following devastating earthquakes in February.

title.children: Türkiye sends pup to Mexico in gratitude for rescue dog who died saving earthquake survivors
